heisigStory: Person . . . samurai. The key word means to wait on someone or serve them.
koohiiStory1: Back in the day, a person who stands beside a samurai is usually attending to them or working for them.
koohiiStory2: [+fuaburisu] Mr T attends to Tom Cruise in the Last Samurai, who is doing hara-kiri. Imagine Tom Cruise outside in the final scene, stabbing his knife into his stomach, while Mr T looks patiently on. "I pity da foo....no, really.".
myStory: chữ sĩ. quan, người làm việc. nhân + sĩ.
readingExamples: 仕事 (しごと), 出仕 (しゅつし), 仕える (つか.える)
words: to lay in stock, to replenish stock, to procure
device, trick, mechanism, gadget, (small) scale, half finished, commencement, set up, challenge
to commence, to lay (mines), to set (traps), to wage (war), to challenge
to partition, to divide, to mark off, to settle accounts, to toe the mark
devising, plan, plot, contrivance, construction, arrangement
to tailor, to make, to prepare, to train, to send (a messenger)
to be used to a job, to begin to do, to baste, to tack, to plant
to finish, to close, to do something completely, to put away, to put an end to
